result.execSummary:
The defendant John Lee Heard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is immediately eligible for SAP.
Defendant is eligibile for CIP only after serving 2 years initial confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
***Per Court order dated 6-17-15;  Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.***
Payment of all court obligations and supervision fees.

Obtain or maintain full time employment.
Complete high school diploma.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

No contact with confidential informant.
No contact with V.W. - unless approved by agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact wiht anyone possessing, consuming or selling illegal drugs.
No contact with any place that is known to sell illegal drugs.

CGIP Programming and follow through.
AODA treatment and follow through.
Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Dept. of Corrections.
Participate in assessments and counseling as directed by DOC.
